title.narrative: The Philippines: GOJUST: Support to Study Tour on an Integrated Criminal Justice System

description.narrative: 1. To position Philippine officials to further institutionalize the JSCC as a national policy level coordination mechanism; 2. To better understand major policy developments in a European context regarding the administration of the criminal justice system; 3. To see first-hand how coordination mechanisms at the national and local level work to tackle basic underlying problems in the justice sector; 4. To experience how information generation, sharing, analysis and reporting for informed decision making can be improved through automation in support of policy decisions by the JSCC; 5. To learn about mechanisms for effective coordination between police investigators and prosecutors as part of the case file preparation process to secure the end goal of a conviction of criminal cases handled in court; and 6. To examine how structural changes are shifting incentives for criminal justice sector agencies to achieve common objectives, tackle backlogs, improve performance and bring costs down.

A senior cross sector delegation, including the Honorable Chief Justice, the Honorable Secretary DOJ, the Honorable Secretary DILG, selected justices of the Supreme Court and the Court of Appeal and heads of key criminal justice agencies including the Prosecutor General, Director General of Philippine National Police (PNP) and the Chief of Bureau of Jail Management and Penology (BJMP) and a representative from the JSCC Secretariat and from GOJUST is proposed.
The project aimed to organize a Study Tour/Exposure Visit for high officials from the Philippines to Strasbourg, France and Madrid, Spain in mid-September 2019.
